compilations.description: Calling all seafood lovers! Cooking fish and shellfish at home may seem intimidating — but it doesn't actually have to be. These easy popcorn shrimp, for example, are ready in under 30 minutes and only need five ingredients. Or, if you're already a seafood pro, impress everyone with this gourmet-style herb-crusted salmon. Let’s get cooking!

compilations.description: It’s alright to want to be fancy. After all, what’s better than a gourmet, home-cooked meal at the end of a long day? But if actually cooking it is where you get stuck, we’re here to help. Whether you’re craving a comforting chicken Parmesan or want to get fancy with a classy prime rib, these recipes will bring gourmet straight to your kitchen. So grab your apron, because gourmet is about to get fun, easy, and super delicious.

compilations.description: Have some chicken in the fridge and looking for something light to whip up for dinner? The One-Pan Lemon Pepper Chicken is perfect for you. compilations.description: Do you love salmon but hate monotony? The same grilled salmon, day in and day out, can really get you down. Luckily, we've curated a few diverse ways you can mix it up to enjoy your favorite fish even more. The spinach-and-cheese-loadedsalmon wellington is a total delight. compilations.description: Weeknights are tiring enough, and by the time the weekend hits, date night turns into home Netflix binges, fuelled by pints of ice cream and hot Cheetos. But well, you don't have to get dressed up and go out to treat yourself! Especially to restaurant-quality seafood. Instead, whip up these fancy seafood dinners: our show-stopping Scallops With Caper Pan Sauce, Nobu-Style Cup sushi made by Nobu's very own chef, or our divine mussels in white wine. Don your apron and filet those fish – you deserve oceanic delights of a lifetime.

compilations.description: Whether you like sugary pastries or savory indulgences, we’ve got your back. results.description: Puff Pastry Salmon, also known as Salmon Wellington, is an impressive dish perfect for a special occasion. A beautiful piece of salmon is wrapped in buttery puff pastry with a delicious filling of spinach, cream cheese, and herbs, resulting in a flaky and flavorful centerpiece.

instructions.display_text: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
In a pan over medium heat, melt butter. Add the garlic and onions, cooking until translucent.
Add the spinach, salt, and pepper, cooking until spinach is wilted.
Add the breadcrumbs, cream cheese, parmesan, and dill, stirring until mixture is evenly combined. Remove from heat and set aside.
On a cutting board, smooth out the sheet of puff pastry. Place the salmon in the middle of the pastry and season both sides with salt and pepper.
Place several spoonfuls of the spinach mixture on top of the salmon, smoothing it out so that it does not spill over the sides.

Fold the edges of the puff pastry over the salmon and spinach, starting with the longer sides and then the shorter ends. Trim any excess pastry from the ends, then fold the ends on top. Flip the puff pastry-wrapped salmon over and transfer for a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Brush the beaten egg on the top and sides of the pastry. Score the top of the pastry with a knife, cutting shallow diagonal lines to create a crosshatch pattern.
Brush the top again with the egg wash.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, until pastry is golden brown.
Slice, then serve!
Enjoy!

results.name: Puff Pastry Salmon (Salmon Wellington)

components.raw_text: 1 sheet puff pastry, softened to room temperature

tips_summary.content:
• Reduce the amount of breadcrumbs for a less dry and heavy spinach mixture 🥬
• Adjust the salt content to avoid a salty dish 🧂
• Add more cream cheese for a creamier spinach mixture 🧀
• Try different types of cheese like mozzarella or ricotta for a unique twist 🧀
• Experiment with longer cooking times for a more well-done salmon 🐟

compilations.description: You can never go wrong with avocado, and these easy mouthwatering recipes can enjoyed at any time of the day. Start your day with a wholesome Raddish Avocado Toast or enjoy a Salmon Crab Seafood Stack on a lunch date with your special someone. But why settle for one when you have 31 options to try from? Avo-fun for the whole month!
compilations.name: 31 Days 31 Avocado Recipes

compilations.description: Celebrate Taco Tuesday any day of the week with these mouth-watering taco recipes. From classic to creative, any of these taco would make a great snack at your next house party. For something fresh, try the Grilled Shrimp Tacos with Creamy Cilantro Sauce. Or, for any the vegetarians, we have decadent Crispy Potato Tacos.
compilations.name: 5 Easy Taco Recipes!

results.description: These Crispy Fish Tacos will have your taste buds swimming in delight! With a golden, crunchy coating and a zesty slaw, you'll be hooked on this scrumptious dish.

instructions.display_text: Make the cabbage slaw: Combine the cabbage, onion, tomato, cilantro, jalapeño, lime juice, and salt in a large bowl. Toss well, then set aside.
Make the crispy fish: In a large bowl, combine the flour, Old Bay, and baking powder. Add the beer and whisk until smooth. Let sit for 15 minutes.
Heat the vegetable oil in a large pot until it reaches 350°F (180°C).

Coat the fish in the batter, then transfer to the oil and fry until golden on the outside and cooked through, 5-7 minutes. Drain the fish on a wire rack set over a baking sheet lined with paper towels.
Make the avocado crema: Add the avocados, sour cream, lime juice, and salt to a blender and blend until smooth.
To assemble the tacos, add a bit of the cabbage slaw to a warmed tortilla. Top with a piece of fried fish, avocado crema, and sliced radish.
Enjoy!

results.keywords: beer battered, cabbage slaw, cod, fish taco recipe, fried shrimp, homecooking, seafood, tasty
results.name: Crispy Fish Tacos

components.raw_text: ½ head green cabbage, finely shredded
½ medium red onion, small diced
1 pound fresh cod, cut into 1-inch thick strips

tips_summary.content:
• Sprinkle some Old Bay seasoning or Cajun seasoning on the fish for an extra kick of flavor! 🌶️🐟
• Don't be afraid to add some garlic and salt to the fish batter. It'll take it to the next level! 🧄🧂
• Spice things up by adding some jalapeños or cayenne pepper to the fish tacos. Bring on the heat! 🔥🌮
• If the avocado crema recipe makes too much sauce, halve it for a perfect balance. No need to drown those tacos! 🥑🌮
• Feeling adventurous? Amp up the flavor of the avocado crema with some garlic, mustard, or extra seasoning. Give it some pizzazz! 🧄🍯🧂

compilations.name: Dinner Recipes For Every Night In June

results.description: This one-pan salmon and veggies recipe is perfect for a quick and easy dinner. The perfectly baked salmon fillets are paired with roasted potatoes, seasoned with lemon and herbs, resulting in a delicious and healthy meal that's bursting with flavor.

instructions.display_text: Preheat the oven to 400˚F (200˚C).
Cover a sheet pan with foil or parchment paper. Spread out potatoes on the pan and drizzle with olive oil. Season with salt, pepper, 2 cloves of garlic, and 1 tablespoon lemon juice.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Make salmon glaze. Combine salt, pepper, 1 tablespoon thyme, 2 garlic cloves, ginger, 2 tablespoons of olive oil, and 2 tablespoons of lemon juice. Mix well.
Remove potatoes from the oven and push them to the top or side of your pan. Place your salmon fillets on the pan. Brush both sides of the salmon with the glaze.
Place asparagus on the pan and top with 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of thyme on the asparagus and potatoes.
Bake for 10-12 minutes. (The salmon should flake easily with a fork when it’s ready.)
Enjoy!

results.keywords: bake, goodful, one pan, salmon, veggies
results.name: One-Pan Salmon And Veggies

components.raw_text: 2 pounds small red (or yellow) potatoes, quartered

tips_summary.content:
• Try using green beans or broccoli instead of asparagus for a twist 🥦
• Add onions and peppers to the potatoes for extra flavor and color 🧅🌶️
• Give the salmon marinade a touch of sweetness by adding honey 🍯
• Cook the salmon for an additional 5-8 minutes for a more well-done result ⏰
• Adjust the amount of lemon and oil to your taste preferences 🍋🧂

compilations.description: Welcome to the world of easy-to-follow recipes! In no time, you will be making these simple and delicious dishes that will take your cooking skills to the next level. These easy-to-follow recipes will have you cooking up a storm in no time, with basic ingredients that you likely already have in your pantry. From Easy Sticky Chicken Drumsticks to a fancy Maple-Glazed Salmon , you'll be able to cook up something satisfying every time.
compilations.name: Simple But Delicious!

results.description: A delicious and healthy salmon dish with a sweet and savory maple glaze, perfect for a quick and easy weeknight dinner.

instructions.display_text: For the salmon, heat vegetable oil on medium-high in a cast-iron skillet.
For the broccoli, fill a medium pot halfway with water. Add a dash of salt and start boiling water.
In the meantime, whisk together maple syrup, orange juice, soy sauce, garlic, salt, and pepper in a medium bowl.
Set aside 2 tablespoons for topping later.
Place salmon fillets inside the bowl and make sure each side is covered with sauce.
Sear the salmon 2-3 minutes on each side.
Brush the tops with the sauce set aside.
With the pot of water boiling, add the broccoli and cover lid. Blanch for 2 minutes.
Drain under cold water to stop the cooking.
In the drained pot of broccoli, stir in butter, soy sauce, red pepper flakes, some lemon zest, and garlic on low heat. Mix until broccoli is well-coated.
On each plate, serve a filet of salmon and scoop of broccoli.
Top with reserved marinade and sprinkle parsley for garnish.
Enjoy!

results.name: Maple-Glazed Salmon

tips_summary.content:
• Marinate the salmon for longer periods for a more flavorful dish 🐟🍋
• Adjust the amount of maple syrup for a sweeter flavor 🍁🍯
• Use fresh ingredients like ginger and orange juice for an extra zing 🍊🌿
• Add more sauce than the recipe calls for to really amp up the flavors 🌶️💦
• Try alternative cooking methods like baking or grilling the salmon for a different twist 🔥🍽️

compilations.description: Up your game with these simple salmon recipes that will give you dishes just like the ones in your favorite fancy restaurants. Cook up some Asian-inspired Honey and Soy Glazed Salmon. We've also got a recipe for a whole gourmet salmon dinner for you. Get ready to impress!

results.description: Two words: honey salmon! Sure, it takes a tiny bit of prep work, but once you marinate your salmon, you won’t be able to go back. A simple mix of honey, soy sauce, garlic, and ginger coats and flavors your fish for 30 minutes before you throw it on the pan until the outside is perfectly crispy. Once that’s done, you heat up and reduce some extra marinade to make a thick, to-die-for glaze to pour over your filet. Serve with your favorite veggies or rice and enjoy!

instructions.display_text: Place salmon in a sealable bag or medium bowl.
In a small bowl or measuring cup, mix marinade ingredients.
Pour half of the marinade on the salmon. Save the other half for later.
Let the salmon marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
In a medium pan, heat oil. Add salmon to the pan, but discard the used marinade. Cook salmon on one side for about 2-3 minutes, then flip over and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes.
Remove salmon from pan. Pour in remaining marinade and reduce.
Serve the salmon with sauce and a side of veggies. We used broccoli.
Enjoy!

results.name: Honey Soy-Glazed Salmon

components.raw_text: ⅓ cup less sodium soy sauce

results.description: Crispy, golden-brown fish fillets, wrapped in warm corn tortillas and topped with a delicious slaw made with shredded cabbage, red onion, and sour cream. Serve a sprinkle of fresh cilantro and lime juice!

instructions.display_text: In a large bowl, combine green cabbage, red onion, sour cream, lime juice, and salt. Chill until ready to serve.
In a bowl, mix cayenne, garlic powder, cumin, salt, and pepper. Season each tilapia fillet on both sides with the seasoning mix.
Over medium-high heat, cook 2 fillets at a time for 8 minutes, flipping halfway. Repeat for the remaining fillets.
Using a fork, break apart the fillets into bite-size pieces.
Right before serving, heat the corn tortillas in the pan over high heat. Remove from the pan and assemble the tacos with the cabbage slaw and tilapia.
Garnish with cilantro and lime juice.
Enjoy!

results.name: Easy Fish Tacos

tips_summary.content:
• Increase the amount of seasoning for the fish for a bolder flavor 🐟🌶️
• Try adding spices like Old Bay or paprika for an extra kick of flavor 🧂🌶️
• Add sugar to the cabbage slaw for a touch of sweetness 🥬🍬
• Experiment with additional ingredients like radishes, bell peppers, or carrots in the slaw for added crunch and flavor 🌽🥕
• Consider substituting the sour cream with Greek yogurt or mayonnaise for a healthier or creamier option 🥛🥒

compilations.description: Lime is one of those condiments that adds zest, freshness, or even a punch of flavor that sends a tingle all over your tongue. The chili-lime steak tacos are easy to cook up and delicious to eat. Our more classic pairing, lime with tilapia and avocado crema, is sure not to disappoint. And no menu celebrating lime would be complete without a key lime pie with toasted marshmallow meringue! You can put the lime in the coconut but truly, lime is always the star: don't you agree?

results.description: This avocado lime salmon is a healthy and flavorful dinner option. The creamy avocado and zesty lime make the perfect pairing with juicy salmon fillets.

instructions.display_text: Preheat the oven to 400˚F (200˚C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
On the prepared baking sheet, rub the salmon with the garlic, olive oil, salt, pepper, and paprika.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, until cooked through.
Make the avocado topping: In a small bowl, gently mix together the avocado, red onion, cilantro, olive oil, salt, pepper, and lime juice. Don’t overmix or you'll break up the avocado.
Spoon the avocado topping over the salmon.
Enjoy!

results.name: Avocado Lime Salmon

compilations.description: Want to experience the exotic flavors from around the world but too busy to travel? Here's the solution, why not bring the destination to your kitchen! The Japanese culinary export is waiting at your doorstep. Grab your bowls and put on your favorite Ghibli movie because you are invited to bask in the Japanese culinary culture.
compilations.name: Bring Japan To Your Kitchen

results.description: This fresh and healthy bowl is loaded with omega-3 rich salmon, crisp veggies, and creamy avocado for a satisfying meal that's as delicious as it is nutritious. Serve it over rice for a filling and balanced dinner.

instructions.display_text: Add the rice to a fine mesh strainer and submerge in a bowl filled with water. Shake the rice a few times to remove excess starch.

Transfer the rice to a medium pot and add 1 cup (240 ml) of water. Cover the pot and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Once boiling, reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and let stand for 15 minutes.
Remove the lid and fluff the rice with a fork or rice paddle. Transfer the rice to a large bowl.
Mix together the rice vinegar, sugar, and salt and pour over the rice while still hot. Gently fold the rice to incorporate. Cover and set aside until ready to assemble the bowl.
Using a very sharp knife, gently slice the salmon fillet into ½-inch (1 cm) cubes. It may be easier to slice if you place the salmon in the freezer for a few minutes to help it firm up.
Just before assembly, place the salmon in a bowl and season with the soy sauce and lemon juice.

To assemble, place a few spoonfuls of rice into a medium bowl (use any leftover rice for another poke bowl or sushi). Top the rice with the seasoned salmon, avocado, cucumber, ginger, green onions, nori sheets, toasted sesame seeds, and black sesame seeds.
Enjoy!

results.keywords: avocado, fresh, ginger, poke, rice, salmon, sesame seeds, soy sauce, sushi
results.name: Salmon Poke Bowl

components.raw_text: 1 cup water, plus more for rinsing
½ cucumber, halved lengthwise and thinly sliced

tips_summary.content:
• Transform the dish into a sushi cake and add spicy mayo for a fun twist 🍣🎂🌶️
• Reduce the quantity of rice and salmon for a single serving 🍚🐟
• Try different types of fish like seared tuna, smoked salmon, or ahi tuna to switch things up 🐟🔥
• Add extra flavor with ingredients like chili crisp, spicy mayo, poke sauce, or roast Sriracha 🌶️🔥🍛
• Marinate the fish for a few hours before preparing for an explosion of flavor 💥🐟

compilations.description: It's summer time and that calls for a refreshing juicy meal! From easy seared scallops to fancy pineapple sweet chili salmon, this is your perfect go to meal to make you feel like you're at a breezy beautiful beach! Call your friends and family over and share this delicious surprise with them.
compilations.name: 5-Course Summer Meal!
Recipes That Will Actually Leave Your Mouth Watering

compilations.description: Have a date night but not sure what to cook? Don't worry, we've got your back! Cook these very refined Seared Scallops for starters. Followed by Cabernet Braised Short Ribs for main course. Pair up your meal with this very elegant CBD Lavender Lemon Cocktail and your partner is sure to be impressed!
compilations.name: Master Fine Dining At Home!

compilations.description: Nothing says opulence like a refined seafood menu. For a special occasion, choose a dish from our list of super-classy recipes. Start off your meal with simple Seared Scallops. A Black Garlic Honey Butter Lobster Tail speaks for itself. It's sophisticated and super elegant. Make Coconut Broth Clams for an umami palate. Pair your meal with a glass of white wine and you’re good to go!
compilations.name: Sophisticated Seafood Recipes!

results.description: Perfectly seared scallops are served on a bed of creamy risotto and garnished with fresh herbs and a squeeze of lemon for a simple yet elegant dinner.

instructions.display_text: Pat the scallops dry with a paper towel.
Season with salt and pepper.
In a large skillet set over medium-high heat, add the oil.
When the oil is hot, add the scallops and cook until golden brown on one side, 2-3 minutes.
Gently turn the scallops, and add the butter and garlic to the pan.
Continue to cook, spooning the butter over the scallops until they are cooked through, about 3 minutes more.
Add the white wine, cook another 10 seconds.
Serve with chives.
Enjoy!

results.keywords: buzzfeed, chive, crab, crab cakes, dinner, lemon, lobster, lobster roll, lunch, party, salmon, scallops, seafood, snack, summer, tasty
results.name: Seared Scallops

components.raw_text: 1 pound sea scallops, side muscles removed
2 tablespoons unsalted butter, cut into small pieces

tips_summary.content:
• Use high heat to achieve a good sear on the scallops 🔥
• Cook the scallops for a shorter time to prevent them from becoming tough ⏱️
• Cook the scallops for longer to achieve a golden brown color 🌟
• Get creative with modifications like adding lemon juice or white grape juice 🍋🍇
• Pair the scallops with delicious side dishes like risotto, pasta, or vegetables 🍚🍝🥦
